factions.name: The Caravan Collective
factions.description: A vast network of traders and scavengers who roam the wasteland, connecting isolated settlements through commerce. They prioritize profit and survival over all else, maintaining neutrality to ensure safe passage. Their caravans are heavily guarded and recognizable by their patchwork banners.
factions.ideology: Profit through peace. They believe trade is the key to rebuilding civilization and will go to great lengths to protect their business interests.
factions.territory: Nomadic, but they have established trade hubs in abandoned shopping malls and highway rest stops across the region.
perks: Extensive trade network with reliable contacts
Knowledge of safe routes and hidden caches
weaknesses: Over-reliance on trade routes makes them predictable
Internal disputes over profit can lead to infighting

factions.name: The Iron Vanguard
factions.description: A disciplined, militaristic faction composed of former soldiers and survivalists who believe in strict hierarchy and order. They operate from a fortified subway station, using guerrilla tactics to maintain control and eliminate threats. Their motto: 'Strength through discipline, survival through unity.'
factions.ideology: Order and survival above all else. They see chaos as the true enemy and believe only a structured, militarized society can withstand the apocalypse.
factions.territory: A heavily fortified subway station and adjacent tunnels, repurposed into a defensible stronghold with barricades and traps.
weaknesses: Limited numbers due to strict recruitment

factions.name: The Bloodhound Pack
factions.description: A ruthless and highly organized faction of hunters who track both the infected and other survivors for sport and resources. They operate in large, coordinated packs, using brutal tactics to dominate their territory. Their reputation for cruelty is only matched by their efficiency in the field.
factions.ideology: Survival of the fittest; the strong prey on the weak. They believe in proving their dominance through hunting and eliminating any threats, human or otherwise.
factions.territory: They control vast stretches of urban ruins and surrounding forests, using them as hunting grounds to stalk their prey.
perks: Expert trackers: Can follow targets over long distances
Pack tactics: Overwhelm enemies with coordinated attacks
weaknesses: Reliance on territory: Less effective outside their hunting grounds

factions.name: The Silent Reapers
factions.description: A covert militaristic faction specializing in stealth and precision strikes. They operate in the shadows, eliminating threats before they're even aware of their presence. Their members are former special forces operatives who believe in maintaining order through calculated, surgical operations.
factions.ideology: Order through precision—eliminate threats swiftly and silently to preserve what remains of civilization. They view chaos as the true enemy, not just the infected.
factions.territory: Hidden bunkers and underground tunnels beneath ruined urban centers, often near former military installations.
weaknesses: Limited numbers make prolonged engagements risky
Reliance on high-tech gear leaves them vulnerable to EMP attacks

factions.name: The Silent Reapers
factions.description: A covert militaristic faction specializing in stealth and precision strikes. They operate in the shadows, eliminating threats before they're even aware of their presence. Their existence is rumored, but few have lived to confirm it.
factions.ideology: Survival through absolute control and elimination of all potential threats, human or infected. They believe in maintaining order by any means necessary.
factions.territory: Underground tunnels and abandoned subway systems, using the labyrinthine networks to their advantage.
resources: Medical supplies scavenged from military outposts
perks: Ability to move undetected in low-light environments
weaknesses: Limited numbers due to high attrition rate
Reliant on controlled environments for optimal effectiveness
